properties.otherAdvice:
The Enchanted Forest is returning to Shellharbour, from Friday 24 May until Sunday 16 June with the event running from 5.45pm to 10pm Sunday to Thursday and from 5.45pm to 10.30pm Friday and Saturday.

For the duration of the event, a speed reduction will be in place on Shellharbour Rd.

Sydney Film Festival: The Bikeriders film premiere at the State Theatre on Thursday 6 June from 8pm to 11pm.

Lane and footpath closures will be in place on Market St between Pitt St and George St for the event:

  • From 10.30pm Wednesday 5 June to 1am Friday 7 June: lanes 1 and 4 on Market St will be closed.
  • From 6.15am to 11.30pm on Thursday 6 June: the southern footpath on Market St will be closed to pedestrians.

Motorist should expect traffic delays along Market St during the event, allow extra travel time in the area and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads around the theatre.

properties.publicTransport: Light rail services run regularly. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Stakes Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 11am, last race at 4.20pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads, and high volumes of taxi and rideshare pick ups and drop offs.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Panthers v Sea Eagles at BlueBet Stadium. Kick-off at 4.05pm, full time approx. 6.05pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Mulgoa Rd, Jamison Rd and Jane St/Great Western Hwy through Penrith as thousands of fans travel to the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Sydney Swans v Geelong Cats at the SCG. VFL from 11.35am. AFL first bounce at 3.20pm, full time around 6pm.

With up to 40,000 fans expected, traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel to and from the match. Motorists are urged to avoid unnecessary travel in the area before and after the game as delays are expected. Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde, Oxford St and Lang Rd.

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the SCG from 12.20pm and will reopen after the game. No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave.
  • Access to EP2 car park will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd. Car parks open from 12.20pm.
  • To support the Moore Park Rd pop up cycleway, there is no left-turn permitted from Lang Rd onto Moore Park Rd westbound. Motorists can use Cook Rd for access onto Moore Park Rd instead.  

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas between 11am and 8pm including sections of Lang Rd, Oxford St, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

FROM 11AM TO 8PM

  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Cleveland Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Driver Avenue (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

properties.otherAdvice: Prince Street Marketta (street food and entertainment) will be held on Saturday 8 June with Prince Street closed from midday to 11.30pm.

Accusefive in concert on Sunday 9 June from 8pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as attendees travel to and from the event while visitors also attend Vivid Sydney precincts in and around Darling Harbour.

Road closures will be in place on Darling Drive between Pier Street and Ultimo Road from from 5.30pm until midnight for Vivid Sydney, so allow extra travel time.

Road closures will be in place on Saturday 8 June 2024 for the Merriwa Festival of the Fleeces. The Golden Highway will be closed between Dutton St and Marquet St from 4am to 6pm. Motorists travelling through Merriwa over the long weekend should allow extra travel time and expect delays.
properties.diversions: Motorists will be detoured around the highway closure via Marquet, Blaxland and Dutton streets.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Bulldogs v Eels at Accor Stadium. NSW Cup kick-off from 1.40pm. NRL kick-off at 4pm, full time around 5.45pm.

Traffic will be heavy than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as fans travel to and from the match. Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. View the interactive map for closure details.

Allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive should pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space - available until 11:59pm the night before the events unless sold out prior.

NRL: Knights v Panthers at McDonald Jones Stadium. Jersey Flegg from 11.40pm and NSW Cup from 1.40pm. NRL kick-off at 4.05pm, finish around 6.05pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Additional route 199 buses will also run towards Manly and Mona Vale after the game to help you get home. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

NRL: Sea Eagles v Dragons at 4 Pines Park in Brookvale. Jersey Flegg kick-off at 12pm. NRL kick-off at 2pm, full time around 4pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pittwater Rd, Old Pittwater Rd, Warringah Rd and Beacon Hill Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and plan to arrive early as parking will be in high demand, and also be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Jerry Seinfeld Live at Qudos Bank Arena. Show 1 from 5pm, show 2 from 7.30pm.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park while attendees travel to and from the precinct at the same time the AFL takes place at neighbouring ENGIE Stadium.

Allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive are urged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space - available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. View the interactive map for closure details.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Eels v Roosters at CommBank Stadium. NSW Cup kick-off at 5.05pm. NRL kick-off at 7.35pm, full time around 9.20pm.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game. Allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

Roads outside the stadium will close from 9.05pm to 9.50pm after the game to allow crowds to safely leave the precinct.

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St 
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Motorists should follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police and allow extra time when exiting car parks. Avoid driving through the Parramatta CBD while closures are in place and detour via Grose St, Brickfield St, Victoria Rd and Wilde Ave in both directions.

Fans travelling home by taxi or ride share choose a pick up location away from the stadium to avoid traffic delays.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Wests Tigers v Titans at Leichhardt Oval. Kick-off from 3pm and full time around 5pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as attendees travel to and from the match.

Mary St may be partially closed at the oval before the game to allow attendees to safely arrive and leave the venue after the game. Local detours via Chapel St will be in place.

Motorists requiring access to other venues in the Park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains, and event shuttle buses will run from Caringbah, Cronulla and Woolooware train stations before and after the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sharks v Dolphins at PointsBet Stadium in Woolooware. NSW Cup from 5.35pm. NRL kick-off at 7.50pm, full time around 9.40pm.

Road closures will be in place on Captain Cook Drive from approximately 10 minutes before kick-off and remain in place until crowds have cleared after full-time.

Traffic on roads approaching the stadium will be heavier than usual as fans travel to the match in the busy evening peak. Allow extra travel time on Captain Cook Dr, Woolooware Rd and Gannons Rd. 

Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Public transport will be busy as Vivid Sydney also takes place at Central, Circular Quay and Darling Harbour. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A sold out crowd is expected to attend Tsai Chin in Concert on Thursday 13 June. Doors open from 7pm and show starts at 8pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as attendees travel to and from the event while visitors also attend Vivid Sydney precincts in and around Darling Harbour.

Thousands of people are expected to attend the Pirates of the Caribbean in Concert on Saturday 15 June. Shows start at 1pm and 7pm. Our Mob charity event will also be taking place from 6.30pm in the venue.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as attendees travel to and from the event while visitors also attend Vivid Sydney precincts in and around Darling Harbour.

Road closures will be in place on Darling Drive between Pier Street and Ultimo Road from from 5.30pm until midnight for Vivid Sydney, so allow extra travel time.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park while fans travel to and from the match at the same time an event also takes place at neighbouring Qudos Bank Arena.

Allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive are urged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space - available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Rabbitohs v Broncos at Accor Stadium. Kick-off at 8pm, full time around 9.45pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as fans travel to the match during the busy weeknight evening peak. Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Consider parking at a nearby train station commuter carpark and continuing your trip by train to Olympic Park, at no extra cost.

If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. View the interactive map for closure details.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on stadium shuttle buses. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Women’s State of Origin Game II at McDonald Jones Stadium. Prelim match from 5.45pm and pre-game entertainment from 7.15pm. Main game kick-off at 7.45pm, full time around 9.45pm.

With a sold out crowd expected, traffic will be heavy as fans travel to the match in the already busy evening peak. Allow extra travel time on roads in the area, incuding on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd.

CAR PARK UPDATE: all parking at McDonald Jones Stadium is SOLD OUT. Do not drive to the Stadium car park unless you have pre-booked parking. Nearby local parking will be in high demand so if you have to drive, travel with your group, allow extra travel time and plan to arrive early. 

Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Dragons v Wests Tigers at WIN Stadium. Prelim match from 5.40pm. NRL kick-off at 8pm, full time approx 10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to the game during the busy Friday evening peak.

Local roads around the stadium may close before, during and after the game for the safety of pedestrians.

Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.

Motorists should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on public transport. Express trains and Major Event Buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
State of Origin Game I at Accor Stadium. Preliminary game kick-off at 6pm, pre-show entertainment at 7:30pm and State of Origin Game I kick-off at 8:05pm. Full-time approx 10:05pm.

With up to 80,000 fans expected traffic delays are expected during the busy weeknight evening peak.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • Car parks: Pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space. Parking is selling fast.
  • Do not drive unless you have pre-booked parking as there may not be parking available on site. You will need to catch public transport.
  • Consider parking at a nearby train station commuter carpark and continuing your trip on one of the many extra trains running to Olympic Park, at no extra cost.
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events and accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

arrangementElements.html:
Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct and traffic congestion is expected before and after the match. For road closure details, visit the Sydney Olympic Park Authority interactive map.

From 1.30am Monday 3 June to 3am Thursday 6 June

  • Dawn Fraser Ave from Showground Rd to Edwin Flack Ave
  • Olympic Blvd from Herb Elliott Ave to Kevin Coombs Ave

From 12pm on Wednesday 5 June to 3am on Thursday 6 June

  • Kevin Coombs Ave between Pondage Link and Australia Ave (east bound)
  • Olympic Blvd between Sarah Durack Avenue and Herb Elliott Ave
  • Shirley Strickland Ave between P4 Roundabout and Rod Laver Drive
  • Rod Laver Drive at the rear of Tennis Centre.

From 2pm on Wednesday 5 June to 3am on Thursday 6 June

  • Showground Rd from Grand Pde to the Novotel Loading Dock.
  • Murray Rose Ave from Showground Rd to Gate 15, and restricted access from Park St.
  • Grand Pde from Orana Ave to Olympic Blvd
  • Dawn Fraser Ave from Park St to Showground Rd.

From 6pm on Wednesday 5 June to 3am on Thursday 6 June

  • Kevin Coombs Ave between Pondage Link and Australia Ave (westbound)

From 9pm Wednesday 5 June to 3am on Thursday 6 June

  • Edwin Flack Ave from Pondage Link to Old Hill Link (westbound) 
  • Edwin Flack Ave northbound from Birnie Ave to Old Hill Link 
  • Murray Rose Ave from Park St to Australia Ave
  • Dawn Fraser Ave from Park St to Australia Ave 
  • Herb Elliot Ave closed at Park St.
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.publicTransport: On Fridays from 6pm and weekends from 5pm buses and light rail services will not run to Circular Quay. Buses will be relocated to stops at Martin Place and light rail services will run to and from Town Hall only. On Saturday nights and Sunday of the long weekend from 6pm to 11pm trains will not drop off passengers at Circular Quay. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your Vivid Sydney experience.
properties.otherAdvice:
Vivid Sydney returns for its 14th year to light up the city for 23 consecutive nights from Friday 24 May to Saturday 15 June from 6pm to 11pm each night. Motorists are encouraged to avoid travelling around Circular Quay and The Rocks during Vivid or to expect delays on local roads, particularly on weekends.

Roads in Circular Quay, The Rocks and Millers Point will be closed each night from 5pm with additional closures on Friday nights and weekends in the city and around Darling Harbour. Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect each night.

KEY ROAD CLOSURES

Some local roads will be closed nightly including Cumberland St south of Essex St from 12pm - midnight, Circular Quay West at the Overseas Passenger Terminal from 3pm - midnight and Thomas St from Quay St from 5.30pm - midnight.

Monday to Thursdays

  • 5pm – midnight: George St north of Alfred St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Pottinger St, Lower Fort St from George St, Merriman St, Rodens Lane, sections of Harrington St, Argyle St, and Loftus St. In Ultimo, Mary Ann St and Omnibus Lane will close. 

Fridays

  • 5pm – midnight: George St north of Essex St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Pottinger St, Lower Fort St, Windmill St, Merriman St, Rodens Lane, sections of Harrington St, Argyle St, and Loftus St. In Ultimo, Mary Ann St and Omnibus Lane will close. 
  • 6pm – midnight: roads in Circular Quay north of Bridge St including sections of George, Pitt, Young, Phillip and Loftus Streets, and in Ultimo, Darling Dr between Pier St and Ultimo Rd.
  • 7pm – midnight: Erskine St westbound from Clarence St to Sussex St and Kent St southbound from Margaret St to Erskine St approaching King St Wharf.
  • Each weekend from 2pm Friday to 1am Monday, George St will close between Lower Fort St and Hickson Rd for The Rocks markets.

Saturdays and long weekend Sunday (9 June)

  • 5pm - 1am: Grosvenor St/Bridge St between York St and Loftus St, Hickson Rd from Pottinger St to George St, Pottinger St, sections of Lower Fort St, Harrington St, Argyle St, Windmill St, Merriman St, Rodens Lane, and roads in Circular Quay north of Bridge St including sections of George, Pitt, Young, Phillip and Loftus Streets. Near King St Wharf, Erskine St westbound from Clarence St to Sussex St and Kent St southbound from Margaret St to Erskine St will close.
  • No access east/west across the city via Grosvenor/Bridge Streets.
  • 5.30pm - midnight: Darling Dr between Pier St and Ultimo Rd.
  • 7pm - 11pm: Wheat Rd from Harbour St at Darling Harbour.
  • Milsons Point - Saturday 8, Sunday 9 and Saturday 15 June only from 8pm - 10pm: Olympic Drive/Broughton from Alfred St Sth to Fitzroy St.

Sundays and public holiday Monday (10 June)

  • 5pm – midnight: Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Pottinger St, Lower Fort St, Windmill St, Merriman St, Rodens Lane, sections of Harrington St, Argyle St, and Loftus St. In Ultimo, Mary Ann St and Omnibus Lane will close. Roads in Circular Quay north of Bridge St including sections of George, Pitt, Young, Phillip and Loftus Streets. Near King St Wharf, Erskine St westbound from Clarence St to Sussex St and Kent St southbound from Margaret St to Erskine St will close.
  • 5.30pm - midnight: Darling Dr between Pier St and Ultimo Rd.

Managed access to some hotels and businesses around The Rocks and Circular Quay will be maintained by traffic controllers on-site throughout Vivid Sydney when safe to do so.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 3pm to midnight each night on various key roads around Circular Quay and The Rocks, with more widespread clearways in the Sydney CBD in effect on weekends. Some clearways will be in effect on local roads earlier in the day.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: George Street, Hickson Road, Bridge St, Grosvenor Street

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Disney on Ice at WIN Entertainment Centre on Thursday 20-Sunday 23 June. Thursday Session at 7pm, Friday Session at 11am & 7pm, and weekend Sessions at 10am, 2pm & 6pm daily.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the Wollongong CBD and on local roads around WIN Stadium as attendees travel to and from the match. Allow extra travel time.

Local roads around the stadium may close to help crowds move safely around the area.

Attendees travelling to the event on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Road exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Road, both in and out of Wollongong.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Rabbitohs v Sea Eagles at Accor Stadium. Kick-off at 7:35pm, full time around 9.20pm.

Traffic delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct as attendees travel to the match at the same time AFL fans leave nearby ENGIE Stadium. Travel with your group and allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Dr and Concord Rd. 

Consider catching public transport or parking at a nearby station commuter carpark and continuing your trip by train to Olympic Park to avoid traffic delays. Match tickets include travel on public transport.  

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Dr roundabout, use Silverwater Rd, Holker St and Hill Rd.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close some local roads to accommodate increased public transport services and ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, visit the Sydney Olympic Park interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.publicTransport: ﻿Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: GWS Giants v Sydney Swans at ENGIE Stadium, Sydney Olympic Park. First bounce 4.35pm, full time around 7.20pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct as attendees travel to the match. Delays are also expected after the game as footy fans travel into the precinct for the NRL at neighbouring Accor Stadium. Attendees are urged to consider the public transport options available to avoid traffic delays.

If you have to drive, travel with your group and allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Dr and Concord Rd. Parking in the precinct will be in high demand so pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.  

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Dr roundabout, use Silverwater Rd, Holker St and Hill Rd.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as attendees travel to and from the expo. Travel with your group and allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Dr and Concord Rd. Ticketholders to Saturday’s event can expect heavy traffic leaving the precinct late afternoon as an AFL match also takes place at neighbouring ENGIE Stadium. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.  

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Dr roundabout, use Silverwater Rd, Holker St and Hill Rd. 

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close some local roads to accommodate increased public transport services and ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, visit the Sydney Olympic Park interactive map for more details.  ﻿

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Bulldogs at Industree Group Stadium. kick-off 1pm, full time approx. 7.30pm

traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including on the Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the match.

Dane Dr will close before the game between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St for the safety of pedestrians and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

NRL: Wests Tigers v Canberra Raiders at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick-off from 11:50pm, full time around 6pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as fans travel to the stadium. Allow extra travel time on roads including Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd.

Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.
